sub_niche: Smartwatches, Fitness Bands & Wearable Tech Reviews
status: Specialized wearables vertical (distinct from PulseGear fitness focus)

archetype.archetype_expression: The wearable tech expert who tests everything that goes on your wrist, body, or in your ear. Deep technical knowledge paired with real-world testing. Helps people find the right wearable for their specific needs—not the most expensive or most hyped.

soul.one_sentence: The wearable on your wrist should work for your life—we help you find the right one.
soul.expanded: Wearable tech is personal—literally. It's on your body every day. That's why choosing the right one matters so much and why generic 'best smartwatch' lists don't help. We test every wearable for real use cases, specific needs, and honest daily wearability. Because the best wearable is the one that works for YOUR life.
soul.what_we_are: Expert wearable tech reviews. Real-world testing. Specific recommendations for specific needs. Honest about compromises.
soul.what_we_are_not: Not just spec comparisons. Not affiliate-driven rankings. Not ignoring the 'wear' in wearable. Not assuming one size fits all.

if_this_site_were.person: A 36-year-old tech journalist who wears 3 different smartwatches in rotation for testing. Has reviewed hundreds of wearables and remembers the strengths and weaknesses of each. Gets genuinely excited about good design and frustrated by bad user experience. Values function AND form.
if_this_site_were.place: A home office with a display wall of smartwatches and wearables, organized by type and era. Testing equipment for battery life, sensors, water resistance. Evidence of real use—worn straps, used devices, honest testing.
if_this_site_were.time_of_day: Morning workout time—when wearables prove their worth.
if_this_site_were.season: All seasons—wearables need to work year-round.
if_this_site_were.sound: Notification sounds, heart rate beeps, workout complete chimes.
if_this_site_were.texture: Watch bands—silicone, leather, metal, fabric. Smooth screens. The specific feel of a well-designed device.
if_this_site_were.smell: Clean tech, the gym when testing fitness features.
if_this_site_were.temperature: Varied—wearables must work in all conditions.
if_this_site_were.weather: All types—part of testing is weather resistance.
if_this_site_were.music_genre: Workout playlists, focus music during writing.
if_this_site_were.movie: A tech documentary that shows both innovation and real-world impact.
if_this_site_were.book: A comprehensive tech guide that balances specs with user experience.

primary_persona.name: Considering Casey
primary_persona.description: Someone ready to buy a wearable but overwhelmed by options. Has specific needs (fitness tracking, smartphone companion, health monitoring, style) but doesn't know which device best matches those needs.
primary_persona.mindset: Research-mode, specific needs, wants the right choice. Willing to spend for quality but doesn't want to overpay.
goals: Find the right wearable for their needs
Not waste money on wrong choice
Understand what features they actually need
pain_points: Don't know what features matter for them
objections: Is this reviewer paid by the brand?
Will this actually work for my use case?
Am I overpaying for features I won't use?

secondary_persona.name: Upgrading Uma
secondary_persona.description: Someone with an existing wearable considering upgrade. Wants to know if new models are worth it and what's actually improved.
secondary_persona.how_they_differ: Has baseline knowledge, needs comparison to what they own, ROI focus

tertiary_persona.name: Specific Steve
tertiary_persona.description: Someone with very specific needs—medical monitoring, specific sport, professional use. Needs detailed feature analysis.
tertiary_persona.how_they_differ: Needs deep-dive into specific features, niche use cases, specialized recommendations

anti_persona.description: People who want to be told 'the best' without context. Those who only care about status/brand. People who won't read beyond headlines.
anti_persona.why_not: We provide nuanced recommendations. The 'best' depends on your needs.

visual_philosophy.overall_aesthetic: Clean tech editorial—products displayed beautifully, content readable

density.description: Information-rich but organized. Tech content needs detail but not clutter.
density.section_breathing: Clear organization, easy scanning, grouped information
density.never: Never cluttered. Never wall-of-specs. Never overwhelming.

contrast.description: High readability, products pop against clean backgrounds
contrast.approach: Light mode with dark mode support. Products should look their best.
contrast.never: Never muddy. Never low-contrast. Never competing with products.

texture.description: Clean, minimal, let products provide texture
texture.never: Never competing with products. Never busy.

shape_language.primary_shapes: Clean rectangles, subtle rounding like device screens

required_flow: Clear value proposition—finding YOUR right wearable
Browse by category (watches, bands, hearables, etc.)

category_pages.layout_type: Organized grid with filtering by use case, price, features
category_pages.featured_treatment: Editor's picks for different use cases

single_posts.layout_type: Single column with sticky quick-take sidebar
single_posts.sidebar_usage: Sticky verdict box, key specs, pros/cons
single_posts.related_content_style: Alternatives at same price, comparisons, related reviews

grid_philosophy.grid_breaking: Comparison features and guides can span full

spacing_rhythm.breathing_rule: Enough space to compare and scan easily

navigation.philosophy: Category + Use-case—find by what or find by why

primary_nav.item_naming_style: Clear product categories plus help content
primary_nav.dropdown_behavior: Organized by brand and use case

secondary_nav.contents: All brands, all categories, guides, about

breadcrumbs.style: Clear: Home > Smartwatches > Apple > Apple Watch Series 9 Review

search.style: Smart search with suggestions, filter by category

photography_style.color_treatment: Accurate—people need to see real products

image_treatment.overlays: None—products need to be seen clearly

must_include.description: Scannable summary: Rating, Best For, Not For, Key Stats
Who this wearable is actually best for
How we actually tested this device

custom_ui_elements.cards: Product image prominent, key info scannable

voice.perspective: First person (I tested, we found) for authenticity

wearable_gear_hub_is: Tech review style (vs athlete tester style)
Broader categories: hearables, smart rings, etc.
content_differences: All wearables covered (vs fitness devices only)
Tech feature deep-dives (vs workout test results)

what_acceptable_looks_like: But generic—could be any tech site
what_perfect_looks_like: Every review clearly tested over time

tests.screenshot_test: Is it clear we actually test devices?
tests.swap_test: Could this be generic affiliate content? (Must fail)
tests.memory_test: Does reader know which device fits THEIR needs?
tests.ten_second_test: Is real testing methodology immediately evident?

competitive_positioning.how_we_differ: More use-case focused, longer testing periods, honest about trade-offs
competitive_positioning.what_they_do_wrong: Too spec-focused, quick reviews, generic recommendations
competitive_positioning.what_we_do_better: Match devices to actual user needs

seo.internal_linking_strategy: Reviews link to comparisons. Comparisons link to individual reviews. Everything links to best-for guides.
